section.title: Description
section.p: This class is a record of an assertion by the patient, the patient guardian, or someone else in authority that the medication should not be administered. Examples include a parent refusing an immunization for their child based on religious beliefs.

stentry.p: The date that the assertion was made.
The date range during which the exemption is valid. Note that the start date may differ from the date asserted, although they typically will be the same.
See Substance Refusal Reason excluding 'other' (FHIM) definition for values.
Indicates the basis for the Exemption.
"Contains the reason the patient refused the medical substance/treatment. Any entry in the field indicates that the patient did not take the substance." - HL7 Version 2.8, RXA-18
Indicates the practitioner who issued the exemption.
